intro: Eschscholzia marcida var. monticola, commonly known as the Sierra California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a short growing season, blooming in early spring before going dormant. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
